messages.content: ComfyUI-ngrok is a tool that allows external access to ComfyUI using ngrok. It is not a custom node.
No, ComfyUI-ngrok is not a custom node.

To install ComfyUI-ngrok, you need to clone the repository in your ComfyUI custom nodes directory using `git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-ngrok`, install the requirements using `pip install -r requirements.txt` in the ComfyUI-ngrok directory, and replace None on line 12 in the __init__.py file with your ngrok Authtoken.
Where can you find the URL when you start ComfyUI after installing ComfyUI-ngrok?
After installing ComfyUI-ngrok, you can find the URL in the console when you start ComfyUI.
What should you do if ComfyUI-ngrok does not work after installation?
If ComfyUI-ngrok does not work after installation, adding `--enable-cors-header` to the ComfyUI execution argument may help.
What is the purpose of using ngrok with ComfyUI?
The purpose of using ngrok with ComfyUI is to allow external access to ComfyUI.
What do you need to replace in the __init__.py file during the installation of ComfyUI-ngrok?
During the installation of ComfyUI-ngrok, you need to replace None on line 12 in the __init__.py file with your ngrok Authtoken.
